body: Agreed. For advanced settings this makes a lot of sense. I currently have one expander and inside of it there is a "checkbox hack" expander which is less than ideal
@usuixingyili and @apolinario: Could you let me know for which situations you want this? A screenshot or sketch would help a lot!

Absolutely @jrieke! I actually hacked my way into making that work so I can show you exactly the use-case I have for it:

So I have a settings expander for the user:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/788417/172000969-a988af10-d274-46b5-9dab-cc34230b73f1.png)

When I open it, I want to see a minimum set of settings only, to not clutter the UI
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/788417/172001134-af9a0adb-f316-4e1a-b9d6-a6824e070535.png)

But I still wanna leave the option for the user to further use advanced settings if they wish:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/788417/172001144-46e4393e-1752-42ba-8816-edf64a6cbb93.png)

issue.title: Nested expanders

issue.body:
### Problem

I have a use case where I have help text applicable to everyone followed by an optional, deeper dive help info situation that is probably unusual.
### Solution

**MVP:** Simple nesting, one level.

### Additional context

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1165771/171810791-f3a43ed6-f02e-431f-9da8-654f067f9bde.png)

---

Community voting on feature requests enables the Streamlit team to understand which features are most important to our users.

**If you'd like the Streamlit team to prioritize this feature request, please use the üëç (thumbs up emoji) reaction in response to the initial post.**

rename.from: Ability to add st.expander inside a st.expander

issue.title: Allow nesting expander, columns, popover and chat_message

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Removes the limitations to nest `st.expander`, `st.columns`, `st.popover` and `st.chat_message` inside the same layout container type. 

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

- Closes #3861 

## Testing Plan

- Updated tests.
